thread.title: De Gea Reckons He's In Best Form Of Career
thread.title_full: De Gea Reckons He's In Best Form Of Career

title: De Gea Reckons He's In Best Form Of Career
text:
De Gea Reckons He's In Best Form Of Career 11:18, UK, Tuesday 13 October 2015 Share by email Manchester United goalkeeper David de Gea has said he is in the best form he's ever been following his superb performance in Spain's 1-0 victory in Ukraine. 
Dea Gea, who made 10 saves, most of them difficult ones, said: "I have to compete to the max. It's true that I had a bit of luck today, but I did well and I've got to keep it up. I'm in the best form of my career. 
"I will try to be at my best and make things difficult for the coach [Spain manager Vicente del Bosque]. What I want is to maintain the line I had last season, when I think I was at a great level. It's tough to stay at that level, I want to keep growing and improving." 
Spanish media gushed with praise for De Gea's performance in Kiev. 
Marca wrote: "The Ukrainian national team and people will be having nightmares about David de Gea for some time to come. 
"The Yellow and Blues bombarded De Gea for 90 minutes, but the former Atletico star was a match for everything thrown at him - kitchen sink, table, cupboards and all. 
"On no fewer than 10 occasions did Mykhaylo Fomenko's men hit the target, but each and every time De Gea - given the nod in place of the rested Iker Casillas - thwarted them." 
AS added: "Stallone made films with less shots than this match in Kiev. What will go into the records was De Gea's performance. 
"It's clear De Gea is a major figure on the way to completely overtaking Casillas." Promoted Stories
